Keywords: Armor , Avengers , Fantastic Four , Illuminati , Kree , Scientist , Skrulls
Real Name: Reed Richards
Special Powers
RALLY (4): All Attack Rolls. Plasticity. // FREE: Remove Mr. Fantastic's RALLY die and choose an opposing character within range and line of fire. If you did, until your next turn, the chosen character gains Immobile.
SONIC FREQUENCY EMITTERS: When Mr. Fantastic is given a MOVE action, after resolutions remove all non-debris terrain markers within range.
I'LL HANDLE MY END, TONY: Quake, Giant Reach: 3.
Trade Mr. Fantastic Want Mr. Fantastic

The Problem with Mr. Fantastic...

Comments
July 2, 2022
nelson2208
This character is tons of fun to play. His rally die can be game changing when locking down an important piece and his giant reach quake destroys swarms. His sculpt is quirky and unique. I also just fanboy geek out over Reed wearing a stretchy Iron Man suit. Such a fun concept.
January 6, 2022
SuperClixer
Questionable as whether he is worth his points. Would love to see an Errata to make a dial better for a change, rather than to nerf one that is overpowered. Maybe, some damage power such as Exploit Weakness on a top or middle click, to represent the damage he could inflict from him squeezing you with his body, or grabbing and throwing you against a stationary object, such as building or wall.
October 16, 2021
tidge
Stand down soldier... way to focus on a single comment... it is not as if the picture really screams "flying suit". Forll all practical purposes, Mr. Fantastic should normally be allowed to ignore all terrain... except possibly blocking, and even then I'm sure 'walking through walls' would be justified.
October 16, 2021
Buckwheat
What's wrong with the inclusion of Flight? This suit allowed him to fly. He flew in the comic. Or am I misunderstanding you...?
October 16, 2021
tidge
I appreciate that this version has a serious top-dial damage reducer as well as a decent move+attack combination. Plasticity is fine, even if it has lost some cachet. I just can't help but wondering what the reluctance is against giving the character a printed range value on the order of 7 or 8 (single target). In the current era, this is a pricey figure, and I'd gladly lose the traits for either a cost savings or improved range. The inclusion of flight simply convinces me that the design team has forgotten about Improved: Movement.
September 9, 2021
Magneto2179
Maybe heï¿½ll see some play at his lower point value? I could see some use against Molecule Man from FFFF for removing the terrain markers.
September 9, 2021
Goop
I dont know if this guy is super rare worthy. A 6 charge and Giant Reach 3 is pretty nice but he only gives immobile at a range of 3 and thats IF you have a rally die. I'm sure against some 0 range figures it will be good but thats about it. He does give outwit to Kree and Skrulls though which is something they desperately need. He's alright but there are much better 75pt options for Avengers/FF. Has some better potential at lower point line.
